splash.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a liquid splashes, it hits or falls on something and makes a noise
splash.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The ocean splashed against the pier.
splash.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make someone or something wet with a lot of small drops of water or other liquid
splash.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He splashed cold water on his face.
splash.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to make water fly up in the air with a loud noise by hitting it or by moving around in it
splash.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The children were splashing about in the pool.
She ran up the drive, splashing through the puddles.
splash.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if a newspaper or television programme splashes a story or picture on the page or screen, it makes it large and easy to notice
splash.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The gunmanâ€™s picture was splashed across the front page.
splash.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the sound of a liquid hitting something or being moved around quickly
splash.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Rachel fell into the river with a loud splash.
splash.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a mark made by a liquid splashing onto something else
splash.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: There were splashes of paint all over my clothes.
splash.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a small amount of liquid added to a drink
splash.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: a cup of coffee with a splash of brandy
